msContents.summary: A palm-leaf manuscripts containing Rāhulabhadra 's Prajñāpāramitāstotra and the Aṣṭasāhasrikā Prajñāpāramitā. The 'Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines' (Aṣṭasāhasrikā Prajñāpāramitā) is one of the earliest Mahāyāna scriptures. This foundational sūtra of Mahāyāna Buddhism developed gradually over a period of about two hundred years, from the first century BCE to the first century CE (some of its earliest recensions were translated into Chinese during the Han dynasty, 206 BC – 220 CE). There is still no scholarly consensus as to the provenance of the text, but the most widespread view is that it was probably written in central or southern India. The 'Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines' presents its doctrine in the form of a dialogue between the Buddha and one of his disciples, the arhat Subhūti. In this dialogue the principal ontological message (message concerning what ultimately exists) […] is an extension of the Buddhist teaching of not-Self to equal no essential unchanging core, therefore no fundamentally real existence, as applied to all things without exception (Williams 2009; 52). This sūtra belongs to the early stratum of the so-called 'Perfection of Wisdom (prajñāpāramitā) literature,' subsequently expanded between the second and fourth centuries CE into other huge scriptures, for instance the 'Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines' (the Śatasāhasrikāprajñāpāramitā). The 'Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Stanzas' enjoyed a central role in the Buddhist cult of the book, and particularly in Newar Buddhism. The manuscript is protected by two painted wooden covers.

msItem.title: Prajñāpāramitāstotra
Nirvikalpastuti
Nirvikalpastava
Prajñāpāramitādevyā Ekaviṃśatistotra
Prajñāpāramitaikaviṃśatistotra
Shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bstod pa
Rnam par mi rtog pa'i bstod pa
msItem.incipit: [1v1] nirvikalpe namas tubhyaṃ prajñāparamite mite || yā tvaṃ sarvānavadyāṃgi niravadyair nirīkṣase || ākāśam iva nirlepāṃ niḥprapaṃcāṃ nirakṣarāṃ | yas tvāṃ paśyati bhāvena sa paśyati tathāgataṃ ||
msItem.explicit: [1v5] vyavahāraṃ puraskṛtya prajñaptyarthaṃ śarīriṇām || kṛpayā lokanāthais tvam ucyase tvaṃna cocyase || śaktaḥ kas tvām iha sto

msItem.title: Aṣṭasāhasrikā Prajñāpāramitā
msItem.incipit: [2r1] || evaṃ mayā śrutam ekasmin samaye bhagavān rājagṛhe viharati sma || gṛdhakūṭe parvate mahatā bhikṣusaṃghena sārddha|m arddhatrayodaśabhir bhikṣuśataiḥ sarver arhadbhiḥ kṣīṇāsravair niṅkāśvar vaśābhūte suvimuktacittaiḥ suvimuktaprajñair ājāneyair mahānāgaiḥ kṛtakṛtyaiḥ kṛtakaraṇīyair apahṛ[2r2]tabhārair anuprāptasvakāccaiḥ parikṣīṇabhavasaṃyojanaiḥ samyagājñāsuvimuktacittaiḥ sarvaceto¦%vaśiparamapāramitāprāptai||r eka pudgalaṃ sthāpayitvā yadutāyuṣmattam ānandaṃ || tatra khalu bhagavān āyuṣmanta su%bhūtiṃ sthaviram āmantrayate sma ||
msItem.explicit: [4v2] evaṃ hy ata bodhisatvena ma [space left blank for miniature] mahāsatvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ cari%tavya || ayaṃ ca bodhisatva¦[space left blank for miniature]sya mahāsatvasya sarvvadharmāpari[4v2]gṛhīto nāma samādhiḥ vi[space left blank for miniature]pulaḥ puraskṛtaḥ || apramāṇa%niyataḥ || asādhāraṇasa[space left blank for miniature]rvvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhaiḥ sāpi sarvva%jñatā aparigṛhītā || na [space left blank for miniature] hi nimittatro grahītavyā || [4v4] sa cen nimittato grahītavyā [space left blank for miniature] 'bhaviṣyate || na ceha śreṇikaḥ % parivājakaḥ śraddhām ala[space left blank for miniature]psyata || atra hi śreṇikaḥ sarvajñajñāne adhimucya | śraddhānusārī prādeśike¦[4v5]na jñānenā[line-fillers until the end of the line]
msItem.incipit: [5r1] pravarttayitavyā || ihaiva prajñāpāramitāyām upāyakauśalyasamanvāgatena sarvabuddhadharmasamu%dāgamāya yogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ || tatkasya hetor ihaiva hi prajñāpāramitāyāṃ vistareṇa sarvvabuddhadharmā u%padiṣṭa yatra bodhisatvena śikṣitavya yogam āpattavyam || atha khalv āyuṣmān su[5r2]bhūti bhagavantam etad avocat_ | yo bhagavann etad eva bodhisatvaānāmadheyaṃ na vedmi nopalabhe na sa%manupaśyāmi prajñāpāramitām api na vedmi nopalabhe na samanupaśyāmi | so haṃ bhagavann etad eva bo¦%dhisatvanāmadheyam avindann anupalabhamāno 'samanupaśyan prajñāpāramitām apy avindann anu[5r3]palamāno 'samanupaśyaṃ katamaṃ bodhisatvaṃ katamasyāṃ prajñāpāramitām avavadiṣyāmy anu%śāśiṣyāmy etad eva me bhagavaṃ kaukṛtyaṃ syād yo ham vastvavindann anupalabhamāno 'samanupaśyan nāmadhe¦%yamātreṇāyavyayaṃ kuryāṃ yad uta bodhisattva iti | api tu khalu punar bhagavan tad api nāmadhe[5r4]yaṃ na .i [-1-]taṃ nāsthitaṃ na viṣṭhita nāviṣṭhitaṃ |
msItem.finalRubric: [20v6] || āryāṣṭasā%hasrikāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śakraparivartto nāma dvitīyaḥ ||^^^|| 24[letter numeral]2 ||
msItem.explicit: [111v6] iti lokaḥ śūnya iti lokaṃ sūcayaty evaṃ jñāpayaty evaṃ lokan sandarśayati | iti lo%ko acintya iti lokasānta iti loko vivikta iti lokaviśuddhyā lokaṃ sūcayaty evaṃ jñā¦
msItem.finalRubric: [112r1] || āryāṣṭasahasrikāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ lokasandarśanaparivartto nāma dvādaśaḥ || 385 || ba ||
msItem.explicit: [112v6] vijñānasya hi subhūte pramānaṇan na prajñāyate | sarvvadharmāṇām api hi subhūte pramāṇan na prajñāyate | kena kāraṇena subhūte rūpasya pramāṇan na prajñāyate | kena kāraṇena vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇāṃ | kena kāraṇena subhūte vijñānasya pramāṇan na prajñāyate | — — —
msItem.incipit: [113r1] sarvadharmāṇām api pramāṇaṃ na prajñāyate rūpasya hi subhūte pramāṇan na vidyate, evam vedanāyāḥ saṃ%jñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇām vijñānasya hi subhūte pramāṇam na vidyate, sarvadharmāṇām api hi subhūte pramāṇaṃ na vidyate, kena % kāraṇena subhūte rūpasya pramāṇan na vidyate |
msItem.finalRubric: [151r2] || āryāṣṭa[161r3]sāhasrikāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyām upāyakauśalyaparimīmānsāparivartto nāma viśati¦% maḥ ||^^^|| 230 ||
[160r2] || āryāṣṭasāhasrikāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ kalyāṇamitraparivartto naā %ma saṃyogena dvāviṃśatimaḥ ||^^^||
msItem.explicit: [172v6] ākāśena na sa devaputrāḥ sārdham vivaditavyam manyeta | yaḥ satvānāṅ kṛtaśaḥ saṃnāhan samnaddhavyaṃ % manyeta | ayaṃ ca sannāho bodhisatvena mahāsatvena satvānāṅ kṛtaśaḥ sannaddhaḥ sā cātyantatayā satvaā %nikayalabdhi uktā tathāgatenāhaṃnā samyaksaṃbuddhena sā ca satvaviviktatayaiva veditavyā vaina
msItem.incipit: [173r1] yikavivaktayā ca sattvaviviktayātā veditavyā | sa ced atraivaṃ bhāṣyamāṇe bodhisatvamahāsattvo na saṃsīdati |
msItem.explicit: [204v5] yāvad ānandeśaṃ prajñāpāramitā loke pracariṣya-2-[204v6]vat tathāgatā tiṣṭhatīti veditavyan tāvat tathāgato dharman deśayiṣyatīti veditavyam avirahitās te % ānanda satvām te buddhadarśanena dharmaśravaṇena saṃghopasthānena ca veditavyām tathāntikāvacarās te ānanda % veditavyā | ya enāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śroṣyanty udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti pa-2-
msItem.incipit: [206r1] psyaṃti pravartayiṣyaṃti deśayiṣyaṃti | upadekṣyaṃty | uddekṣyaṃti | svādhyāsyaṃti | likhiṣyaṃti | satkariṣyaṃti |
msItem.explicit: [206r2] idam avocad bhagavān āttamanās te ca maitreyapramukhā bodhisatvā mahāsatvā āyuṣmāṃś ca subhūtir āyuṣmāṃś ca śāriputra āyuṣmāṃś cānaṃdaḥ śakraś ca de-2-m iṃdraḥ sadevamānuṣā suragaṃdharvaś ca loko bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanaṃdann iti ||^^^||

[206r3] -1- .āptā ceyaṃ bhagavatyāryāṣṭasāhasrikā prajñāpāramitā sarvatathāgatajananī sarvabodhisatvapratyeka.u -1-śrāvakāṇāṃ mātā dharmamudrā dharmolkā dharmanābhir dharmabherī dharmanetrī dharmaratnanidhāna[206r4]makṣa yā dharmakoso dharmāciṃtyādbhutadaśananakṣatramālā dharmatāparamasukhahetur iti ǀ sadevamānuṣāsuragaṃdharvalokavaṃditāṃ prājñāpāramitāṃ samyagudgṛhya dhārayitvā cayitvā pravartyenāṃ viharaṃtu sadārthina iti ||^^^||
msItem.colophon: [206r4] ye dharmā hetuprabhāvā hetus teṣāṃ tathāgataḥ || hy avadat teṣāṃ ca yo nirodha evaṃvādī mahāśramaṇaḥ ||^^^||

physDesc.p:
Composite manuscript consisting of four codicological units (kernel and three dependent codicological units):
First codicological unit (kernel, ff. 5-111, 113-172 and 174-205): a palm-leaf manuscript from the 11th century, text in Nepālākṣara
Second codicological unit (f. 112 and f. 173): palm-leaf supply, text in Nepālākṣara
Third codicological unit (ff. 2-4): paper supply with yellow verso, text in Nepālākṣara.
Fourth codicological unit (f. 1 and f. 206): paper supply with yellow verso (f. 1) or recto (f. 206), text in Devanāgarī.

supportDesc.condition: Complete, in good condition. Damaged on margins, original and modern restorations; worm eaten. Folios 123, 189, 196 damaged with loss of text.

origin.origDate: 11th century (the letter-numerals in the foliation are similar to the ones in Add.1643, Add.1683 and Add.1464; see for instance the letter-numeral for the decades on f. 110 and following).

history.provenance: Bought by Wright, Daniel Dr. D. Wright in 1875.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact Cambridge University Library Admissions).
